text: Ori la ba bo, a ba f'orisha sile. (Honor the head, and the orisha will follow.)
Agbára ọkàn ju agbára ara lọ. (The strength of the mind surpasses the strength of the body.)
Ọ̀nà kan ò wọ̀ ọjà. (There is more than one road to the market.)
Bí adìẹ kò bá rìn ní ìmọ̀, oníré kò ní bá a. (If the hen does not scratch, it will not find food.)
Ọmọlúwàbí kì í ṣe ohun tí kò tọ́. (A person of character does not do what is improper.)
However long the night, the dawn will break.
When the roots are deep, there is no reason to fear the wind.
A tree is known by its fruit.
If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
It takes a village to raise a child.
The river is filled by many little streams.
No matter how tall a tree grows, its leaves will always fall to the ground.
Ori buruku kì í bọ́ l'ọ́jà kí gbogbo ọjà má mọ̀. (An ill-fated head cannot be hidden from the marketplace.)
Ọ̀rọ̀ tó bá dùn nínú, kì í tán níta. (What is sweet within will eventually show without.)
Lion’s whiskers don’t grow by fear alone. (Courage grows through trial.)
Ambient Abuse: The Counter-Power of Suggestion — transmute the imprint.
Gnosis is memory made radiant.
Community crowns the individual who can carry the weight of light.
When you breathe with your ancestors, storms become choreography.
Ori is a compass; walk, and it aligns.
